alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Natrona County through 715 PM MDT... At 629 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Homa Hills, which is also 12 miles north of Casper, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Antelope Hills around 635 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 196 and 204. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
